summary: This is a Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate movements, staffing issues, and counts. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations on a date shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the same facility on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations Log
events.description: Routine prison operations at MCC New York including inmate counts, transfers, admissions, releases, and staff assignments. Notable events include a Treaty Transfer return due to flight cancellation, inmates placed on suicide watch and in dry cells, and multiple correctional assignments vacated due to staff shortages.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a daily operations log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York dated August 9, 2019, one day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.
It reports chronic staffing shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments for Sanitation, Phone Monitor, Sally Officers, Recreation Officers, and SHU posts.
The log notes a malfunctioning Control Center Fire Panel and Public Address System, and that fire watch procedures were in place.
Multiple inmates were on suicide watch or psychological observation, and one was placed in a dry cell.
The document provides a detailed inmate count (beginning at 759) and tracks movements between units, admissions, and releases throughout the day.
